Girl's Day

Introduction

Park Sojin popularly known as Sojin is a South Korean singer and actress under Noon Company. She is best known for being the Leader and Lead Vocalist of the South Korean pop girl group Girl's Day under DreamT Entertainment. Before debuting, Sojin used to be a vocal trainer for the K-pop boy band Ulala Session.

Sojin debuted in the South Korean pop girl group Girl's Day under DreamT Entertainment as an original member and Leader and Lead Vocalist with their debut single "갸우뚱 (Tilt My Head)" on the 7th of July 2010.

On the 17th of June 2017, an industry source reported that Sojin and Eddy Kim had been dating for two months. The next day, DreamT Entertainment confirmed the reports, clarifying that initially denied the rumors because they wanted to protect one another. On the 27th of December 2017, DreamT Entertainment revealed that the couple had broken up, but did not reveal the reason for it.

On the 11th of January 2019, DreamT Entertainment announced that Sojin would be leaving the agency after deciding not to renew her contract which expires in February. On the 19th of March 2019, Sojin signed up with Noon Company to launch her career as an actress but emphasized that she is taking a break from group activities but she is still part of Girl's Day.

On the 6th of October 2023, an industry source reported that Sojin and actor Lee Dong-ha would be getting married in November. The next day, both of their agencies confirmed the reports. It was then later announced that the wedding would be held privately on November 18, 2023.
